thread.title: Eight MSSU Softball Players Earn All-America Honors
thread.title_full: Eight MSSU Softball Players Earn All-America Honors - FOX 14 TV Joplin and Pittsburg News Weather Sports |

author: Jacob Lenard
title: Eight MSSU Softball Players Earn All-America Honors
text:
RELEASE FROM MISSOURI SOUTHERN ATHLETICS:
Louisville, Ky. - Eight Missouri Southern Lions softball players have been named NFCA All-America Scholar-Atheltes from the 2015 season.
The National Fastpitch Coaches Association (NFCA) announced that 5,493 softball players across seven membership divisions earned NFCA All-America Scholar-Athlete honors for the 2014-15 academic year. Of the 833 student-athletes in Division II eight Lions were named NFCA All-America Scholar-Athletes. The eight Lions named to the list were freshmen Sydney Blue , Shelby Madden , and Abi Corbett , red-shirt freshman Myranda Stewart , sophomore Lindsey Gorham , junior Alana Hester , seniors Kathryn Goins-Osburn and Brooke Swadley .
To earn the NFCA All-America Scholar-Athelte honor student-athletes had to have a 3.5 GPA or higher.
Southern will open their 2016 season on February 5th as they travel to Durant, Oklahoma to take part in the Southeastern Oklahoma State Tournament.
